result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Lowery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol.
No contact with co defendant J.G. or with victims and their families.

Must enter, participate, and successfully complete any counseling, assessment, or treatment deemed necessary by agent.
Maintain employment.

Case called: 10:46am
State appears by ADA D. Runde; Defendant appears by video/pro se from Kettle Morraine Correctional Facility.
*All appearances by zoom*
(Hearing re ERP Eligibility)

State notes receipt of 3/16 letter from defendant requesting JOC indicate that he is eligible for ERP.
COURT notes that a hearing ordering that defendant be eligible for that programming was held by Judge Falstad on 7/21/17 (including these files: 14CF668, 14CF824, 15CF100, 15CF309, 15CF310, 15CF421, 16CF1052); However it appears 16CF1052 should not have been left out, and no AMENDED JOCs were prepared, which is what defendant is requesting.
COURT orders that an AMENDED JOC be completed in ALL files, including 16CF1052, to reflect the order from Judge Falstad from 7/21/17 that defendant is eligible for programming, and a copy of the JOC in 16CF1052 be sent to defendant in Kettle Morraine.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 2:04pm
INCLUDES 14CF668, 14CF824, 15CF100, 15CF309, 15CF310, 15CF421, 16CF1052
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke; Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty Jeff Jazgar
Date and time set for sentencing in all 7 cases and plea in 16CF1052

Plea in 16CF1052:
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
PLEA: Ct. 1 Battery by Prisoners- repeater >> GUILTY
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.
Parties stipulate to not increasing cap of 10 years IC at WSPS and will have 60 days to determine restitution amount 

Sentencing in all 7 cases: 
Atty Jazgar makes argument on restitution amounts and victim impact statements and asks court for time to review state's restitution amounts and statements
COURT allows Atty Jazgar time to review documents
OTR: 2:29pm BOTR: 2:51pm
State makes argument on restitution and is ready to proceed with sentencing today
Atty Jazgar makes argument and is ready to proceed with sentencing today after receiving state's documents
Atty Jazgar would like a few minutes to discuss penalties with deft prior to sentencing
OTR: 2:57pm BOTR: 3:02pm
Atty Jazgar states deft is ready to proceed today with sentencing
State proceeds with argument on sentencing
Atty Jazgar makes argument on sentencing
COURT makes ruling
COURT ORDERS: 14CF668 Ct. 1 (Burglary-building or dwelling, PTAC): 12 and half years WSPS- 7 and half years IC, 5 years ES. 15CF100 Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine): 3 and half years WSPS- 1 and half years IC, 2 years ES. Ct. 3 (Bail Jumping-Felony-repeater): 5 years WSPS- 3 years IC, 2 years ES. 15CF310 Ct. 1 (Retail Theft-intentionally take >$500-$5000 repeater): 3 and half years WSPS- 1 and half years IC, 2 years ES. 15CF421 Ct. 1 (Burglary-building or dwelling, PTAC-repeater): 15 years WSPS- 10 years IC, 5 years ES. Ct. 2 (Burglary-building or dwelling, PTAC-repeater): 15 years WSPS- 10 years IC, 5 years ES. 16CF1052 Ct. 1 (Battery by Prisoners-repeater): 6 years WSPS- 3 years IC, 3 years ES. All sentences concurrently. 265 days credit granted. 
CONDITIONS of ES: Absolute sobriety from drugs & alcohol. Must enter, participate, and successfully complete any counseling, assessment, or treatment deemed necessary by agent. Maintain employment. Submit DNA sample, unless deft has already provided it. Pay costs and supervision fees as directed by agent. No contact with co-defendant (J.G.) or with victims and their families. Restitution to be paid to Walmart of $539.60. Restitution to A.W. of $2,750.00. Restitution to D. M. of $9,174.28. Set further restitution hearing if needed for Atty Jazgar to speak to deft to further look into D.M. restitution requesting. Restitution to be paid at rate of 25% of prison wages NOT by gift money. Deft is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Programming or Substance Abuse Programming. 
Parties to maintain PSI in confidental manner. 
Deft to be remanded to MC Sherriff's Dept to be transported to Dodge Correctional
